Package com.example.mini_pekkas.ui.event.user

Class EventJoinFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
com.example.mini_pekkas.ui.event.user.EventJoinFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
public class EventJoinFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
A fragment that handles joining an event's waitlist. The fragment displays event details, and allows the user to join the waitlist by providing a device ID. It fetches event data from Firebase based on the QR code data passed to it and allows the user to confirm joining the waitlist via a dialog.

    • fetchEventFromFirebase

      private void fetchEventFromFirebase(String qrCodeData, SharedEventViewModel sharedViewModel)
      Fetches the event details from Firebase using the provided QR code data. Updates the event details in the shared and local view models.
      Parameters:
      qrCodeData - The QR code data used to fetch the event.
      sharedViewModel - The shared view model used for updating the event data.

    • showJoinDialog

      private void showJoinDialog(android.app.AlertDialog dialog, android.widget.Button joinButton, android.widget.Button cancelButton, com.google.firebase.firestore.GeoPoint location)
      Shows the dialog for joining the waitlist and allows user to either join or cancel
      Parameters:
      dialog - The AlertDialog with either a simple confirmation or with a geolocation confirmation if needed
      joinButton - The button to join the wait list
      cancelButton - The button to cancel joining the wait list
      location - The geo location of the user if needed. Null if not used
